pullRequest.body:
Let `n` be a positive integer. This PR defines `BoxIntegral.unitPartition.Box` which are boxes in `ι → ℝ` obtained by dividing evenly the boxes of the integer lattice`ι → ℤ` into smaller boxes of sides of length `1 / n`.  

These boxes will be used in another PR #12405 that relates point counting in sets and integration.

This PR is part of the proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula. 

---

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

> Modulo small fixes to the docstrings and some minor golfing, this looks good to me.

Thanks for the review. I'll work on improving the PR following your remarks shortly.
Modulo small fixes to the docstrings and some minor golfing, this looks good to me.
Modulo small fixes to the docstrings and some minor golfing, this looks good to me.

```suggestion
Fix `n` a positive integer. `BoxIntegral.unitPartition.box` are boxes in `ι → ℝ` obtained by
```
Do you really want to use `PNat`s here? (The alternative would be to replace `(n : ℕ+)` by `(n : ℕ) [NeZero n]`.)

```suggestion
Let `B` be a `BoxIntegral`. A `unitPartition.box` is admissible for `B` (more precisely its index is
admissible) if it is contained in `B`. There are finitely many admissible `unitPartition.box` for
```

```suggestion
tag situated at its "upper most" corner). If `B` satisfies `hasIntegralVertices`, that
```

```suggestion
* `BoxIntegral.hasIntegralCorners`: a `Prop` that states that the corners of the box have
```

```suggestion
`unitPartition.Box` that are subsets of `B`. This is a finite set.
```

```suggestion
has integral corners, then the prepartition of `unitPartition.box` admissible for `B` is a partition
```

```suggestion
/-- A `BoxIntegral.Box` has integral corners if its corners have coordinates in `ℤ`. -/
```
Did you mean "vertices"?

```suggestion
  simp_rw [mem_ball_zero_iff, pi_norm_lt_iff (Nat.cast_pos.mpr hC), Real.norm_eq_abs, abs_lt] at hx
```

```suggestion
  let C : ℕ := ⌈R⌉₊
  have hC := Nat.ceil_pos.mpr hR₁
  let I : Box ι := Box.mk (fun _ ↦ - C) (fun _ ↦ C )
    (fun _ ↦ by simp only [neg_lt_self_iff, Nat.cast_pos, hC])
  refine ⟨I, ⟨fun _ ↦ - C, fun _ ↦ C, fun i ↦ (Int.cast_neg_natCast C).symm, fun _ ↦ rfl⟩,
    le_trans hR₂ ?_⟩
```

```suggestion
  have h_npos : 0 < (n : ℝ) := Nat.cast_pos.mpr <| n.pos
```

```suggestion
/-- The tag of (the index of) a `unitPartition.Box`. -/
```
Why not use `(ν i + 1) / n` here (to be consistent with `tag` below)?

```suggestion
  simp_rw [tag_apply, div_left_inj' (c := (n : ℝ)) <| (Nat.cast_pos.mpr n.pos).ne', add_left_inj,
    Int.cast_inj] at this
```
`field_simp` tends to be slow...

```suggestion
  exact ⟨lt_add_of_pos_right _ <| by positivity, le_rfl⟩
```
This is not really a job for `norm_num` (there are no computations with numerals involved).

```suggestion
/-- For `x : ι → ℝ`, its index is the index of the unique `unitPartition.box` to which
```

```suggestion
  rw [not_iff_comm, Set.not_disjoint_iff]
  refine ⟨fun ⟨x, hx, hx'⟩ ↦ ?_, fun h ↦ ⟨tag n ν, tag_mem n ν, h ▸ tag_mem n ν⟩⟩
  rw [← mem_box_iff_index.mp hx, ← mem_box_iff_index.mp hx']
```

```suggestion
  rw [BoxIntegral.Box.Icc_eq_pi]
  refine ENNReal.toReal_le_of_le_ofReal (by positivity) <| EMetric.diam_pi_le_of_le (fun i ↦ ?_)
  rw [Real.ediam_Icc, box, add_sub_cancel_left]
```
Maybe add a
```lean
lemma box.upper_sub_lower (ν : ι → ℤ) (i : ι) :
    (box n ν ).upper i - (box n ν).lower i = 1 / n := by
  rw [box, add_sub_cancel_left]
```
and use it here and below.
`by norm_num` should be `by positivity`, but `positivity` cannot deal with `ENNReal`s...

```suggestion
  · exact lt_top_iff_ne_top.mp <| measure_lt_top_of_subset
      (by simp only [Set.iUnion_subset_iff, Set.inter_subset_right, implies_true]) hs₂
```
`aesop` is slow.

```suggestion
/-- For `B : BoxIntegral.Box`, the set of indices of `unitPartition.Box` that are subsets of `B`.
This is a finite set. These boxes cover `B` if it has integral corners, see
```

```suggestion
`unitPartition.box` whose index is `B`-admissible. -/
```
This is data, so it would be better not to use tactics to construct it.

```suggestion
    I ∈ (prepartition n B).boxes ↔ ∃ ν ∈ admissibleIndex n B, box n ν = I :=
  mem_prepartition_iff
```

```suggestion
  rw [le_div_iff₀' (by positivity), le_sub_iff_add_le,
    show (n : ℝ) * a + 1 = (n * a + 1 : ℤ) by norm_cast, Int.cast_le, Int.add_one_le_ceil_iff,
    Int.cast_mul, Int.cast_natCast, mul_lt_mul_left (by positivity)]
```
is better readable.

```suggestion
  rw [← add_div, sub_add_cancel, div_le_iff₀' (by positivity),
    show (n : ℝ) * a = (n * a : ℤ) by norm_cast, Int.cast_le, Int.ceil_le, Int.cast_mul,
    Int.cast_natCast, mul_le_mul_left (by positivity)]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Analysis/BoxIntegral): Add BoxPartition defined by subdivision of the integer lattice

source.title: feat(Analysis/BoxIntegral/UnitPartition): Prove results linking integral point counting and integrals
feat(NumberTheory/NumberField): proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula
